meanings.definition: The state or condition of being without a voice.
meanings.sent1: Her voicelessness made it hard for her to express her opinions.
meanings.sent2: The voicelessness of the character in the story added to the mystery.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the talking animals highlighted the voicelessness of the main character.
meanings.sent4: The voicelessness of the protesters was deafening in its impact.
meanings.sent5: The voicelessness of the child in the noisy room was palpable.

meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of lacking a voice.
meanings.sent1: The voicelessness of the singer surprised the audience.
meanings.sent2: His voicelessness in the meeting was noticeable to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The voicelessness of the robot made it endearing to the children.
meanings.sent4: The voicelessness of the forest at night was eerie.
meanings.sent5: The voicelessness of the mountain echoed in the valley.
